newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian U-Wood, Puncak buyout approved.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian U-Wood, Puncak buyout approved.

text.p: Plywood maker, U-Wood Holdings Bhd said on Tuesday it has received government approval to acquire the concession holder of a water privatisation scheme in Malaysia's Federal Territory and the central Selangor state.
The concession holder, Puncak Niaga (M) Sdn Bhd, will be acquired through funds raised from a rights issue, U-Wood said in a statement issued by its merchant bank.
U-Wood said the government's Economic Planning Unit (EPU) has approved the proposed rights issue of 40 million shares at 4.50 ringgit per share.
Both the acquisition and rights issue were submitted for approval in 1995.

Puncak Niaga, awarded the privatisation project a year earlier pending procedural approvals, will be fully responsible for managing and expanding water supply requirements in the Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur and Selangor state.
U-Wood said the deal will now require approval from the Securities Commission.
